CrowdStrike and another security firm, ThreatConnect Inc. of Arlington, Va., said they found evidence pointing to Russian government involvement in the DNC hack when they analyzed the hackers' methods and efforts to distribute the stolen emails and other files.
The hacker groups, identified by CrowdStrike as Cozy Bear and Fancy Bear, used different but sophisticated techniques to break into the DNC and try to avoid detection.
Most of the DNC emails appeared to have been stolen May 25.
